title: Reducing Gun Violence and Making Our Communities Safer

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to aggressively use existing authorities to reduce gun violence through enhanced enforcement, improved firearm regulation, community interventions, and better support for survivors. It also requires agencies to report on implementation of gun safety legislation and encourages efforts to promote safe firearm storage, prevent illegal gun dealing, and support mental health for affected individuals.
potential_concerns: Enhanced enforcement and expanded regulation may inadvertently burden lawful gun owners with increased compliance requirements.
Efforts to publicly release firearms dealer inspection reports could raise privacy and reputational issues for licensed dealers.
The orderâ€™s call for expanding extreme risk protection orders ("red flag" laws) might raise due process and civil liberty concerns.
Limited funding or attention to other public health or safety priorities could occur as resources are redirected toward gun violence prevention.
Ensuring coordination among multiple federal agencies with different missions may cause implementation delays or inefficiencies.
